page.title: 05SCHOOLS IN PENDLESIDE
page.content: Newchurch School was built in l874 and today there are 27 children aged between 5 and ll on the register. As it is a church-aided school the vicar visits each Friday to take assembly. The headmistress is Mrs. Elizabeth Johnston and the subjects taught are Maths., English, Science, RE, History, Geography, PE and music. There is a kitchen attached to the school with a resident cook. School begins at 9.00a.m. and ends at 3.30p.m. Leisure activities include swimming at the local baths, three miles away, rounders, netball and we also have a football team that visits other local schools. The two highlights of the year are the prizegiving in June and the Christmas Concert.
